title: Integration Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst (Boston, MA)
Interview Descriptions: Easy first round of screening. I was told that I would sure be contacted following week. But did not hear back till I sent a follow-up email. Response was a generic email saying they had already filled the position prior to my application. Frustrating.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at UMass?

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst
Interview Descriptions: Interview was pretty straight forward. Very comfortable interview. Did not feel nervous or intimidated. They asked pretty much standard questions that are typically asked during all interviews. The interview lasted approximately thirty to forty five minutes.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weaknesses

title: Residential Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst
Interview Descriptions: Behavioral interviews ask for situational and theoretical questions, mainly about topics of diversity equity, and inclusion as well as student life overall. Questions also revolved around time management, responsibility and leadership.
Interview Questions: In the past year, describe how your personal values and beliefs have guided your decisions about your daily activities during the COVID-19 pandemic. How has this decision-making process been challenging and how has the end result helped you in supporting yourself and your immediate community?

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst
Interview Descriptions: One meeting with two advisors. Offered a position several weeks later in one of the aforementioned advisor's laboratories. I was not asked too many questions in the interview other than about my educational background and programming skills.
Interview Questions: Do I have experience with Matlab?

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst (Amherst, MA)
Interview Descriptions: The interview is two full days. The first is one group interview discussing current events in the industry. The second day was an individual interview with department chairs and professors.
Interview Questions: What type of leader are you?

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst
Interview Descriptions: They asked about 5 questions that related to how well I would be able to do my job as an RA. The questions were about my previous experiences. The interview was with an RD or ARD and potentially some RAs from their cluster.
Interview Questions: How would implement DEI in a residential community?

title: Executive Assistant Position Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and was contacted a week later to do a zoom interview with 8 people. Most of the people in the interview were there under obligation and had zero to do with the position or would have been working with the EA. They all looked super bored and unfriendly. They were there to ask a generic question, say thank you and that was it. Very negative atmosphere. Zero conversation or any information about the position or office culture. Didn't get the position but would not have wanted to work with such a miserable group of individuals anyway. Not one person smiled during the one hour we were on video.
Interview Questions: Very generic- how do you prioritize tasks, how do you stay  organized, why do you want this position. When I asked a very specific question relating to something in the job description that seemed very important, the response was 'oh that's not something important, don't worry about it.' Then why is it in the job description?

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst
Interview Descriptions: Went in for one in person interview. Was given no directions to the building or where to park. The first interviewer didn't have any questions prepared and when I would say something or answer a question, the response was 'ok' after every single thing I said and that was it. I didn't even get to interview with the person the job would have been supporting even though I was scheduled to because something had some up on their schedule. Very unorganized.  It was a huge waste of time.
Interview Questions: Was asked to talk about myself that was it.

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst
Interview Descriptions: The position was master's level. The interview process was quite succinct - why I am interested in the job, how my qualifications align with the role, then some chat about the field.
Interview Questions: What is your familiarity with economic valuation methods such as contingent valuation?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst
Interview Descriptions: They asked a few questions and the answers I gave were pretty basic. She asked if I could manage my classes on top of the TA job and if I could show up every class, I promptly said yes and she said the job was mine.
Interview Questions: Got any experience teaching? Are you familiar with college biology?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst
Interview Descriptions:
A very typical process for one applying the position of GRA
Friendly, chilling interview process
Instantaneous feedback after the interview
Great help from everyone and thank you for your caring all the time
Interview Questions: Q: Tell me about yourself

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: questions about skills you have, previous work experience, why you want to work for this lab and what makes you best for this role, university grades, and what you wish to achieve from this role
Interview Questions: what skills have you aquired from pervious work experience?

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is very straight forward and happens simultaneously with multiple other groups around you. They will ask you usual question like what do you do on campus, a time you struggled, and a time you worked as a team.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst
Interview Descriptions: Great, wanted to just get to know my interested and why I wanted to join the lab. We spoke about my academic and research background. I would really recommend, he is very nice.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in behavioral neuroscience?

title: Assistant Director of Communications and Content Strategy Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst (Amherst, MA)
Interview Descriptions: Consisted of a virtual interview and then an in-person visit to campus. Met with five different people or teams. Was friendly and professional, with the exception of one person who was in a baseball cap and hoodie. Turns out they were just going through the motions and the job went to an internal candidate. It was a waste of time.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this job? What will you do to promote diversity?

title: Student Affairs Officer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst
Interview Descriptions:
Pretty straight forward and easy. Just ask your schedule and your experience. Super nice lady and experience. Definitely will work again ! Nothing else do add. I’m not sure what else to
Add
Interview Questions:
What’s your class schedule? 
Ted

title: Associate Development Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst
Interview Descriptions: Prompt, professional, engaging. Quick follow up. Did send me an email to let me know I didn't get the role. There was an interview and I was asked to submit writing samples
Interview Questions: One thing they asked about was how my prior development experience would translate across indsutries

title: Bus Driver Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst (Amherst, MA) in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview was robust. They asked me if I had a driver's license and why I wanted to drive a bus. They also explained to me about the bus driving training sessions. The bus training sessions are paid and the overall salary increases over time.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to drive a bus.

title: Full Stack Developer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst
Interview Descriptions: Very comfortable and open. Explored Django and Flask as potential frameworks. Spoke about my previous experience and how I envisioned taking the project forward and completing it. The rest of the interview was quite informal. Fact that it is part of the university is the reason.
Interview Questions: Mention your previous experiences with web development?

title: Summer Internship Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst
Interview Descriptions: really great. it was a nice and comfortable interview. the interviewer was nice. i really enjoyed talking with him.  just be prepared to talk about your past experience for the interview.
Interview Questions: resume questions. your past experience

title: New Student Orientation Leader Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst
Interview Descriptions: There were several steps including a team problem-solving session and one on one interview. It is really important to be involved without being overbearing and make sure everyone has a chance. Make sure you smile.
Interview Questions: Talk about a time you had to work as a team?

title: Postdoc Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst
Interview Descriptions: First contacted by email to schedule a regular phone interview screening. Then one-day onsite interview to give a research talk and meet a bunch of different people in the lab.
Interview Questions: Why do you choose Umass?

title: Data Science Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst
Interview Descriptions: Hr and Behavioral Interview, asked me questions on my resume and my motivation to apply. What was my previous experience, what appeals the most to me about the job position, etc.
Interview Questions: Motivation to apply for the position?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst
Interview Descriptions: A Skype interview was scheduled with a principal investigator over email. They were very friendly and I got a final decision email e few weeks after the Skype interview. The process was very easy.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to come to our school

title: Laboratory Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst
Interview Descriptions: Email communication with follow-up questions followed by a video interview. Received an initial email communication shortly after submitting my application. Response time after the video interview took a few weeks.
Interview Questions: Do you have any questions for me?

title: UGTA Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst (Boston, MA) in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions: Asking questions during an interview helps determine if the role is right for you. Ask these four questions during your next interview to help land the job. 4,700+ Club Locations. From researching the company to closing the deal, here’s how to interview like a boss. Watch this video to get the best interview tips for marketing and business students.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst
Interview Descriptions:
Bord room still interview there are 80 other ppl getting interviewd around you.
You will sit across 3 other members of Res life; typically two current RAs and an RD or an ARD
Interview Questions: How does [experience] relate to the RA role

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst
Interview Descriptions: No interview required for PhD students in ChemE. You apply the Graduate School Application package and you should be all set. Wait to hear back some time in February if you are domestic.
Interview Questions: No interview. No questions.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst (Amherst, MA) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: on-campus interview and then questions on research methods and materials and then description of past research efforts that may be relevant to the post. Finally, and then, discussion with the research scientists that are working in various posts.
Interview Questions: What is your passion that may contribute to the post?

title: Undergraduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst in Dec 2019
Interview Descriptions: Very easy and straightforward. I came in and briefly discussed my understanding of the course material, any experience I had with teaching/tutoring, and why I would be right for the job. Told me that they would let me know within a week!
Interview Questions:
What would make you right for the job?
Have you had experience in tutoring or teaching before?

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst
Interview Descriptions: They have a list of 10 questions on the table and one former RA and one RD interviews you asking you the questions. They take notes on what you say and after the interview talk about your strengths weaknesses and whether or not they recommend you for the position.
Interview Questions: What role do you play in the community?

title: Dining Room Server Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst (Amherst, MA)
Interview Descriptions: This was a straight-forward minimal interview process - a resume was not necessary, but being a student was required for part-time positions in the dining halls. You should also be sure to know your availability going in to speak with the manager, and they require a minimum of 10 hours per week
Interview Questions: What is your availability?

title: Communications Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst (Amherst, MA) in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: I applied for a temporary communications position at UMass via their website; the director of communications for this specific department emailed me back within a few days saying that I seemed "horribly overqualified" but that he'd like to meet with me anyway. We had a one on one meeting soon after, and while he was clearly incredibly intelligent and capable, he mostly talked at me for over a half hour. I felt like I had to insert anecdotes about work I had done and advocate for why I'd be a good fit for the role. Ultimately he went with another candidate, which seems like the right choice because I don't think our work styles vibed for a two person team.
Interview Questions: Why I wanted the job. That's all, no additional questions. I qualify this interview as easy because I really wasn't asked anything, although that could also make it difficult because who knows what they're actually looking for without explicit questions.

title: Line Cook Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst (Amherst, MA) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: It was very simple, walked in for an interview, was asked if I had previous food experiences and was hired on the same day. Very easy and smooth process, interview was with shift manager.
Interview Questions: Do you have previous food service experience

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst
Interview Descriptions: Five 30 minute chats with very friendly professors, most questions were based on soft skills. Some questions on research experience. Overall positive experience, the school just was not for me.
Interview Questions: Why would you want to do research in this lab?

title: Customer Service Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst
Interview Descriptions: Did the online application then came in for an interview, was able to hear back from them a week later that I got the job. The process was very streamline and had no problems overall.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weaknesses.

title: Dining Services Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst
Interview Descriptions: Asking the easy questions, not that difficulty. It is pretty easy for a student to do in the interview. Actually, they need a lot of student each semester for the dinning service. It is good money earning for college kids.
Interview Questions: How can you contribute to the group?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst
Interview Descriptions: Had to have work study, met with the supervisor and manager. The supervisor is usually a professor in that specialty with a manager, could be a graduate student. They asked a series of questions such as where do i see myself, what do i hope to get from this position and so on
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years

title: Building Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: You have to work there before at least one semester and then apply within. It is a letter of interest and your resume sent via email. Then you will have an interview with the supervisors and you will get their decision within a week. Sometimes they will ask people without them applying.
Interview Questions: Are you a team player?

title: Teacher Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst (Amherst, MA) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: Talked with professor about employment and research opportunities. Although I did not originally find anybody, my prior undergrad research experience (1 1/2 years in lab with extensive project) warranted a professor to reach out to me.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to come to graduate school? (not much of a big shock but very common so think of this as your mission statement)

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst
Interview Descriptions: I knew the professor and he offered me a freelance position over the summer. I had to show my work done under him previously and the grades I'd gotten in his course.
Interview Questions: What projects have you worked on? Do you have relevant experience in my field?

title: Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst (Amherst, MA)
Interview Descriptions: Interview with Principal Investigator of the project at hand. Casual, very individual experience. Helpful to have had a referral from a friend. Resume matched PI's interests and expectations. They were interested in my future intentions with research and how this position would help progress me forward, while also making sure I was a strong fit for the role at hand.
Interview Questions: Experience and goals for the future

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: You just need to submit your PS with at least three recommendation letter. Maybe you get an interview but maybe you just get the position without the interview. If you have some published papers there is a chance you don't get an interview and you accept without it.
Interview Questions: NA I got the offer letter without questions or interview.

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst
Interview Descriptions: I asked the professor for a lab role. Generally, research assistants are recruited through referrals or having a class with the professor. It is almost always up to the student to initiate or indicate interest to the professor.
Interview Questions: What research interests you?

title: Anthropology and Area Studies Librarian Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst in Nov 2018
Interview Descriptions: This was a fairly standard interview process: a first-round phone interview followed by a second-round all-day interview on campus. I appreciated that for the second interview, the committee gave allowed me to see a hard copy of the questions.
Interview Questions: The presentation prompt that I was given was What does being an Anthropology and Area Studies Librarian mean to you, and what will you do in your first 90 days in this role?

title: Peer Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 8 weeks. I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: Submitted application and had a 30 min long interview with 2-3 interviewers. 1 of which is the LCG and the 2 others were current peer mentors.  They listed about 6-7 questions in front of you and you can keep referring back to those. They will take notes during that time.
Interview Questions: Name one challenge that you have encountered and how you resolved it.

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst
Interview Descriptions: Overall the process is quite easy. It starts with a submission of your resume, and this is where minimal people are cut, the interview is where most people are cut. The issue with the interview is the limited spots and high number of applicants.
Interview Questions: Team Management Experience?

title: Data Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst (Amherst, MA) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: they just ask you quick few questions about what you have done and how good you handle the same work over and over again. They also ask you to demonstrate your ability to handle data accurately.
Interview Questions: how do you demonstrate your ability to handle data accurately?

title: Talent Acquisition Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: I received an email to come in for an interview. I did not receive a phone screen or get to talk with the hiring manager prior, to determine if the role was a mutual fit, prior to coming on site. When I came on site I meet with the hiring manager for 20 mins who spewed information about the role at me before leaving to pick up her son. I was left to interview with two people who have not even looked at my resume or prepared any interview questions. Then I had a second interview with four more people who again, had not reviewed my resume or prepared interview questions. It was painful. Finally, the hiring manager returned to walk me out and said I would hear within a week about second interviews, never heard from anyone again. Definitely one of the worst interview experiences, I've had.
Interview Questions: Have you worked with search commits?

title: Student IT Consultant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst
Interview Descriptions: There are 2 boss who interview you. Firstly they introduce the job and tasks to you. Then they ask scenario questions and behavior questions. You can ask them questions in the end,
Interview Questions: what makes you stand out of others?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst (Amherst, MA) in Jul 2018
Interview Descriptions: Interview was not quite difficult. Questions were centered on the task of the job description. I faced a panel who grilled on my qualification and experience. Later I had another meeting with the person who is to be my supervisor.
Interview Questions: In a difficult situation how would you maneuver in the lab?

title: Education Technology Support Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst (Amherst, MA) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: Discussed what I expected from the job and what I would be doing. Went over what types of people I would run into and what kind of issues were common as well as what I have learned from my previous jobs.
Interview Questions: What was a time at a previous job that was a learning experience?

title: Event Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was moderate. The team was friendly and accommodating. The questions had to do with my experience and what I will bring to the position. Also, I was asked if I am familiar with Higher education policies.
Interview Questions: Tell me about how you approached a difficult situation from a client?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview with numerous professors of varying expertise and experience. Length was approximately 60 minutes and was used to screen candidates for an in-person interview. Generally, it was professionally conducted.
Interview Questions: Present on past research accomplishments and future research plans

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst (Amherst, MA) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: Two people would have a panel with you and question you regarding your job. Your manner of character and how you interact with the interviewers is important part of the decision. Essentially while they ask you questions you are making yourself presentable for the position.
Interview Questions: Give a time where you had to deal with a difficult situation?

title: Director of Development Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst (Amherst, MA) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: There was an initial face to face with the HR person. Then 2 phones interviews and a final face to face. The second phone interview was with a panel. The final face to face interview was with 2 people.
Interview Questions: Experience on the job

title: Lab Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst (Amherst, MA) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: Asked about my schedule and resume.  Showed me around the work area and told me what the regular workday looked like. Overall it was a really pleasant experience and was not challenging at all. Interviewer was very friendly
Interview Questions: What does your schedule look like?

title: Executive Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst (Amherst, MA) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: Phone and then on campus interview.  They also were willing to meet with me close to my home and allowed me a second visit to campus where they gave me a tour and unlimited access to employees that I would be working with.  I spent time in what would be my office space and was given a tour of town.  All of it was very helpful.
Interview Questions: Mostly about my background and my thinking about how to improve things at UMass

title: IT Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst (Amherst, MA) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: I was first asked to do an in person interview where I was sent to a waiting room with other applicants. They called us in one at a time and asked questions about computer problems.
Interview Questions: What do you do if you can't log in to a computer?

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst
Interview Descriptions: Just basic questions about duties and hypothetical situations. Just try to accentuate your diversity and how much you appreciate diversity and social justice. Also it helps to not be white, as apparently there is a quota as to how diverse the student staff has to be.
Interview Questions: They just ask hypothetical questions like how would you deal with a bias incident or something like that.

title: Ombuds Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst (Amherst, MA) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed via phone, in person in front of panel of 5 people. They were friendly. It felt very formulaic. To prepare it is probably best to rehearse different responses related to diversity, accountability, and success.
Interview Questions: How do you define conflict resolution?

title: Bus Driver Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst
Interview Descriptions: Simple history questions, driving a van. All and all, it is not that hard of an interview. Anyone with half a brain can get this job. You will be okay and have fun at this company.
Interview Questions: Do youi have a clean driving record?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst (Amherst, MA) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: Varies from department to department; I went through a staffing agency. The one I had was very lax and almost casual because they needed someone to fill the position immediately.
Interview Questions: How well do you handle stress?

title: Peer Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst
Interview Descriptions: The interview has two parts: a series of questions and a brief presentation. You are interviewed by a Learning Communities Graduate and two current Peer Mentors. The atmosphere is very relaxed.
Interview Questions: How do you build a diverse and inclusive community?

title: Server Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst (Amherst, MA) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: Walked into the catering headquarters was asked if I had any food service experience and was handed a one page application. There was clearly a shortage of staff members available this semester and as a result this made it quite easy to get a job.
Interview Questions: Do you have any food service experience?

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst (Amherst, MA) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Single round interview in open layout auditorium simultaneously with many other applicants. One Residence Director along with two Resident Assistants are present to conduct the interview in person. Ten questions total relating to hypothetical situations or situations where you've done X.
Interview Questions: Describe a time where you resolved conflict within a group.

title: Clerk IV Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst (Amherst, MA) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: Interview was 3 rounds about 20-30 mins each.  Each round with a different pair of office staff.  The staff members would take turns with questions.  Every round had a different set of questions. They had three rounds because the position that was open requires that these members like the person.
Interview Questions: What makes me a good candidate for the position?

title: Educational Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst (Amherst, MA) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: I filled out an application form which included my GPA, course history, and Major/Minor. I then met with the hiring manager who was also one of the lead education advisers for student athletes. She interviewed me based on my initial application and more in-depth questions regarding my tutoring style etc.
Interview Questions: Have you had experience tutoring student with special educational needs?

title: Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst (Amherst, MA) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: Applied through umass job board and also gave them a direct phone call. They called me up for an interview in 3 days. It was an in person interview. Then I had a tour of the lab
Interview Questions: What are your future ambitions?

title: Maintenance Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst (Amherst, MA) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: pretty informal, met with hiring manager who asked some basic questions and delinieated the requirements of the job and went over what skills i would need. read off rules and regulations to follow
Interview Questions: do you have experience with tools/ power tools

title: Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst (Amherst, MA)
Interview Descriptions: One on one interview. My interview was early in the day and it was a comfortable environment. The questions were mostly based on any experiences had. Not too many questions about personal goals.
Interview Questions: Why are you a good fit for this job?

title: Residence Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst (Amherst, MA)
Interview Descriptions: Pretty standard for an RD position. First was a phone (or skype?) screening which lasted 30 min. Very basic RD questions.  Then was invited for an on-campus interview.  All day (typical RD) experience. Interviewed with people all over campus. UMass took care of the plane ticket/transport, meals, and the hotel.
Interview Questions: Standard RD questions: diversity, supervision style...

title: Administration and Customer Service Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst (Amherst, MA) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Very structured process, great communication throughout the process, and willing to accommodate any needs you may have to ensure you have a great experience, had a great experience in the Q&A sections of the interview staff were willing to be honest with what the position involved
Interview Questions: Questions focused on workflows, organization, communication skills - if you have any experience in maintenance/facilities

title: PhD Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst (Amherst, NY) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: just a few questions closely related to your research experience in the past, mainly focus on your papers and projects, what you did, what difficulties you have encountered, how you overcame them
Interview Questions: tell me about your past research experience

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst
Interview Descriptions: I know this professor, I went to his office and just talk with him. The problems are easy and simple, not too difficult. after 30 mins talking,  he offered me this job. I am really happy about this.
Interview Questions: are you going to do a PhD.

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst (Amherst, MA) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: Following a discussion with this particular professor in person after a class, we discussed the possibility of me doing research in environmental science. She said she would like to set up a meeting to talk about some science with me. At this meeting we had a natural conversation about what I found interesting about science, especially pertaining to medical research. I asked her questions about her published research, what types of interactions she has had with government agencies and different companies, where she hopes to take her current and future research.
Interview Questions: What kind of science out there interests you?

title: Graduate Assistant -Cultural Enrichment Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst (Amherst, MA) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: I responded to the advert on the university job board, got a call one week after for an interview. I was interviewed by a panel of three, the environment was warm and welcoming. very friendly university administrators. Two member of the panel did the asking why the third person was just an observer. After the main interview, we went on to discuss other non-interview related general issues. which, I think was essential to gauge my personality and views on some contentious issues.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself, how is this position related to what you are doing currently and what you plan to do in the years ahead.

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst (Amherst, MA) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: You just have to submit a simple application with your education details and the courses you have taken throughout your academic career. During the interview, the interviewer will ask simple questions about the classes you took and why you want this job. It seemed more like a formality.
Interview Questions: Do you have any tutoring experience?

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst
Interview Descriptions: While I was interviewed for a writing program teaching position for my first year of grad school I was extremely nervous in the interview because I knew I had no prior teaching experience compounded by the fact that without funding, I would need to pay for school with student loans, which I would need to pay back all by myself. So I just felt a lot of pressure in that interview. Also, it was a group interview, with 3 faculty members, 1 of whom had tough questions (the obvious, how would I treat x student with x problem. I wish I had talked to someone who had taught comp before this interview). I wasn't given a position, and I had no funding from Umass my first year. However, I was able to get a teaching position and experience teaching freshmen comp at a different university my first year. With that experience, I was able to get an interview my 2nd year at Umass with the writing program at UMass. I met with 1 faculty member and we discussed my experience and my response to the essay test - which was a sample student essay, for which I had to give my response to that student.
Interview Questions: On the 2nd year interview, the tough question she asked: Given that I would be teaching multiple sections, I wouldn't be able to spend an exorbitant amount of time critiquing one student's essay. How would I balance giving effective feedback with the fact that I had 30 student papers to grade. (She said my response to the student was spot-on, but it was long. I remember trying super hard on it to at least show that I knew what the student's problem was.)

title: Residence Director Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst
Interview Descriptions: 2 30 minute interviews and 1.5 day campus interview.  Not really any curveball questions. A current rd host takes candidate around to all of the interviews. Students interview you during lunch
Interview Questions: What is the difference between advising and supervising students?

title: Media Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst (Amherst, MA) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and was emailed to come in for a one on one interview. Here I brought my portfolio and showed the interviewer the specific programs I knew how to use. These programs were obviously necessary for the job I needed so I came ready to answer specific answers on how I would use specific programs for different set of problems. Was a very stress free interview all together. Just come ready to prove your skills.
Interview Questions: How long I had been using Adobe Creative Suite?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst (Amherst, MA) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: First interview was by skype. This was followed by all day interviews on campus including a public job talk and interviews with the department chair, faculty of the department, and dean. All this followed by a dinner with the search committee.
Interview Questions: What would be your dream course to teach with us?

title: Graduate Students Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: I had to take 2 tests, which are graduate records exam (GRE) and toefl. Using the scores, I had to apply to the university using their application platform. The online application process if quite easy and user friendly. In the application, i was asked to fill in my complete academic credentials and job experience related details.
Interview Questions: They asked about my academic qualifications and 2 recommendations

title: Cashier Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst (Amherst, MA) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: Had to wait in line for the interview for about half an hour. It was a quick sit down with the food services manager, Doug. I handed over resume, it was glanced over, I was asked if I had retail or food service experience, then we began discussing what hours i preferred.
Interview Questions: Do you have retail experience?

title: ARD Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst (Amherst, MA) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: Two professionals and one Grad staff take turns asking questions. It is like a conference style interviewing where there are other interviews going on at the same time so that can get a little tricky.
Interview Questions: What is the difference between supervising and advising

title: Student Support Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst (Amherst, MA) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: There's one face to face interview with the student managers. They ask a few get to know you questions and few technical questions (just to make sure you have a basic understanding of computers and to gauge what your technical knowledge is) and a few questions related to customer service.
Interview Questions: You hear a clicking sound coming from a computer and it won't boot up. What might be the issue?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst (Amherst, MA) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: Had an interview process with the respective professor. The interview consisted of technical questions on my previous background and the current work at the respective lab.  I mentioned some of my ideas for research and some ideas for current research going on. The interview was more like a conversation,  building on your previous answer.
Interview Questions: How did you go about your research in your previous school?

title: Sustainability Communications and Marketing Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst
Interview Descriptions: After submitting a cover letter and resume, I received a call asking me to participate in an interview a few days later. The interview was constructed in a manner that provided the panel with a free 3 hour consultation session, where they milked me for specific ideas - some of which they have since implemented. I should have submitted an invoice.
Interview Questions: Questions ranged from very broad to very specific. There was a panel of 6 people, one of whom was incredibly confrontational and impolite to the point where others on the panel were uncomfortable.

title: Compliance Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: The first step in the interview process was done by phone. It was a four person phone interview. Very awkward for the interviewers and myself. I researched all of the people interviewing me only to have one of them not be present and a replacement instead.  From start to finish it was not a great experience at all.
Interview Questions: I am trying to make a career change so trying to highlight the skills I bring to the table was difficult with what seemed to be formulaic questions that made no sense in light of what I had answered in a previous question. While researching I found some issues with their policies that I had questions about and the interviewers seemed to take umbrage with my questions. Mostly this was because they had no answers. I just felt as if they were unprepared. As a UMASS alum this was disheartening.

title: Hampshire Kitchen Staff Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst
Interview Descriptions: There really isn't much to it. You apply online and then once your approved you meet at the Dining Commons at a specified time.
Interview Questions: There are no questions.

title: Software Developer Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst
Interview Descriptions: phone interview
Interview Questions: only technical questions related to project

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst
Interview Descriptions:
-First step: You have to fill out application before the end of the fall semester. Application consists of several short response questions pertaining to the Resident assistant Job. Applicants must also get a recommendation from a current RA. 
-Applicants are then invited back for interviews. There are two interviews, one group interview, and another individual Interview. During these interviews current residential staff assess applicants. 

The group interview is mainly looking for ability to work well in teams, contributing, respecting others, collaborating. 

The individual interview is a series of questions geared to assessing applicants potential in the RA role.
Interview Questions: Question about response to scenario, if you were a resident Assitant

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst
Interview Descriptions: Spoke with PI about interest in specific research projects.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: PhD Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst (Amherst, MA) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: I got a skype interview and I had gotten three questions about what I wanted to do for future post graduation. It was more about the benefits of the graduate program to pursue my career in specific field.
Interview Questions: How do I envision my career after graduation?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst (Amherst, MA) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: Had a 1 hour long interview with the director and the former assistant director (whose job I was taking over). It was a lovely conversation, casual, fun, stress-free.  Questions were mostly focused on skill sets and personality.
Interview Questions: What are your strength and shortcomings?/ What's the one time you made a mistake, and how did you resolve the situation?

title: Digital Asset Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 7 months. I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst (Amherst, MA) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview was done over Skype because I was in another state. It was done by committee with a diverse group from various departments. A group of 4-5 people were assigned to interview me, a metadata librarian, news editor, staff photographer, software developer, and magazine editor. I had one Skype interview and two in person interviews for this position. I was asked about topics ranging from metadata standards, to technical photography techniques, to conceptual topics such as diversity and inclusion.
Interview Questions: When does a digital asset become too old?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst
Interview Descriptions: Just Submit application. No interview
Interview Questions: No interview

title: Peer Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst (Amherst, MA) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: It is a series of interviews, with Part 1 being a presentation and Part 2 being an 1 on 3 interview. Part 2 involves two current student staffs and a supervisor interviewing a potential candidate.
Interview Questions: What do you think of diversity? How would you address issues surrounding it?

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: The process was a series of two interviews. The first was a group interview, where we held a group discussion then given a group assignment. Throughout this process we were observed by a panel of current RAs. The individual interview was with a current RD or ARD and 2 current RAs, where we were mainly given scenario based questions.
Interview Questions: What made you want to apply for this position?

title: Security Monitor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst (Amherst, MA) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: Show up in line early, watch the presentation, answer the quiz questions. For a 5pm session, I showed up at 4pm and the line was already very long. The presentation/quiz is just "were you listening? what are the rules we just told you?"
Interview Questions: What should you do if someone tries to use an ID that is not theirs?

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst (Amherst, MA) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: I responded to a professors email about working on a research project, was emailed back to set up a meeting, the meeting was very informal and relaxed.  The questions asked were easy and conversation style, not very structured.  They basically wanted to know if you were interested in what you would study and if judge how well you could contribute to the project.  During the closing of the meeting I was informed that I had the position, I was the last interview so they hired me on the spot.
Interview Questions: What makes you interested in the subject?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst (Amherst, MA) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: After submitting my application and meeting the faculty I received a call from my would-be supervisor asking me to interview in person. Interview was very casual; I met with my would-be supervisor and another member of the department in their office.
Interview Questions: They asked about my office skills and availability.

title: Business Consulting Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst (Springfield, MA) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: I had found the opportunity through the career services center at UMass Amherst.  A couple of days after sending my resume, I received a response and came in for an interview the next week.  the interview was about 30 minutes long and seemed to focus on my personality more than my accomplishments.  The next day I was offered the position.
Interview Questions: "Why is your GPA so low?"

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst (Amherst, MA) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: I signed up to go to training session held by a lab there and learned the techniques in the same lab. I was working on my own project with the technique and a professor in the lab was looking for someone to help him conduct his project. He asked me because I knew how to use the technique.
Interview Questions: How much do you understand about using this technique?

title: Peer Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst (Amherst, MA) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: 3 People in a room asking questions, group interview comes after where you are placed in a situation that needs solving. The questions were provided before hand so you could prepare easily and the group interview section was to test your leadership/work ethic.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be a peer mentor?

title: Undergraduate Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst
Interview Descriptions:
I am working as an undergraduate for a professor. If you find a good professor then the "hiring" process is very simple. I actually went to this professor to talk about something else and when I mentioned that I was interested in research he offered me the position. Later I expressed that I had workstudy and he said that he could afford to pay me then. The professor is extremely nice and has reasonable expectations. He assigned a post-doctorate to me and she is also very kind, has helped me with my research and with my grants. Overall my work is self guided but everyone in the labs has been very kind and helpful when I am in need. 
Best way to get a job is to personally meet with a professor, they get emails all the time so an in person meeting is more personal and gives the professor a better idea of if you would mesh well with the group or not.
Interview Questions: I guess his most unexpected question was what research project I would be interested in participating in, then he listed off some of his Graduate Level Polymer Engineering Projects, I am an Undergraduate Environmental Science Major!

title: Librarian Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 8 months. I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst
Interview Descriptions: Embarrassingly long process and poorly managed.  In total the interview process was 8 months, all finalists were subjected to invasive/time consuming background check and they were hesitant to reimburse for travel.  I found out the job was filled once the listing was taken down and I emailed.. I fear otherwise they wouldn't have contacted me.  A very poor reflection of what seemed to be a great institution.
Interview Questions: Pretty standard for faculty librarian positions

title: Bus Driver Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst (Amherst, MA) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: We did a quick sit-down, and then I drove the interviewer around campus in a van. It was mostly informal, and the staff were friendly and up-front about demands of the job.
Interview Questions: Would you say that you are punctual?

title: Video Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst (Amherst, MA) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: Easy peezy lemon squeezy! I got the job just by applying on the umass job board website. If you can't hold a camera, you're a moron. You will only be asked a few questions and as long as you have a functioning brain you will be able to work for them! You can do it! Go get 'em!
Interview Questions: Do you have experience with video?

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst
Interview Descriptions: 30 minute interviews with about 4-5 faculty members.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Off Campus Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst (Amherst, MA) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview was conducted by the two Graduate Assistants that will be your potential supervisors. They asked pretty standard interview questions that you can expect as a student. Relevant experience, student activities, why you would like to work as an OCA, what your skills are, etc. It was very casual and pleasant and the GAs were welcoming.
Interview Questions: How do you think your off campus experience is unique? How can your experiences benefit other students?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst (Amherst, MA) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: very cordial laid back, normal questions,Tell me about a time when a group project you were working on failed…“Tell me about a time when you took the lead on a difficult project?”
Interview Questions: tell me about yourself

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: The basic interview process was done over Skype because I was not in the country at the time of the interview.  This is pretty normal though.  However, I was not asked many questions that seemed to determine where I would be placed as a Graduate assistant.  Most of the questions were in reference to my professional experience and what that looked like
Interview Questions: Tell us about your experience as a Real Estate developer.

title: Lab Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst (Amherst, MA) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: I was asked to be interviewed over Skype. The conversation was friendly and not intimidating. This really depends on the Lab you work in. I was asked about my basic skills and some science questions to check my knowledge of Chemistry.
Interview Questions: What courses have i taken while in college. Do i know how to do basic science. Am i a fast learner?

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst (Amherst, MA) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: Easiest interview, over the phone, hired within a week
Interview Questions: My biggest flaw, considering I do not have many

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst (Amherst, MA) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: Had dinner the night before with 2 faculty members. Easy and cordial. Toured the facilities, met with all faculty and some staff one on one, and as a group. Met with some students and also taught a one hour class for interested students and faculty, including a presentation of my work.
Interview Questions: Would you be satisfied living outside the city. The most favorite and least favorite aspects of the work I do. Particular instances of successes and failures. What was learned from each.

title: Systems Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: Lenghty and no feedback throughout the process
Interview Questions: How to deal with a diverse student body

title: Student Caller Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst (Amherst, MA) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: They ask you to call them and then they check your talking skills over the phone. Then they call you for a mock phone call where they put you in a situation and convince the alumni to donate to his/her school. If you do well/satisfactory then they hire you.
Interview Questions: All questions are quite general.

title: Web Communications Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst (Amherst, MA) in Nov 2011
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was fair and standard for higher education. It had a test component as well. Standard questions: strengths/weaknesses, describe a project you liked/did not like, review of writing samples.
Interview Questions: Strengths and weaknesses

title: Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst (Amherst, MA) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: One-on one interview with Department Chair.  I came highly recommended by an assistant professor on his staff and the University were extremely short on lecturers/professors.  So the chair was basically selling the opportunity to me instead of interviewing me for the position.  It was a very casual conversation.
Interview Questions: There were no traditional interview questions that I recall.  Most of the questions centered around my interest in lecturing on a longer-term basis.

title: Desktop Support Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: Interviewers were friendly and easy going, the process that quick and painless. Some technical questions were asked, but nothing to complicated. Conversation was light hearted that sparked discussions to help get to know me.
Interview Questions: How do you perform a mail merge?

title: Tour Guide Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst (Amherst, MA) in Apr 2011
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process was very lengthy. There was an initial online application, which is now done physically. If the application met the requirements there was a 4 on 4 interview with current tour guides and perspective student respectively. If you made it through that round there was a social of all the current tour guides, involving mingling and a speed dating kind of environment. If you made it through this process there was a final interview with the supervisor.
Interview Questions: Answering a question that a potential parent would ask during a tour related to the party scene on campus.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at The University of Massachusetts Amherst (Amherst, MA) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: I simply applied and the professor interviewed me via a phone call. It was smooth, as the professor was very nice, and passionate about his research. That was the moment when I decided to join the team here if possible. And later I got the admission, with a graduate research assistant position. The professor contacted me again and congratulated me.
Interview Questions: Why are you applying here?
